reviews.review: I've Sunk NEARLY 3500 hours into this game and I've watched the steady decline of it over the past 4 years. It started out fun enough to draw me in. The grind wasn't something I totally minded gave me something to work towards. The Devs have ran this game into the ground though. Make broken killer addons and abilities then "fix" them by adding broken survivor perks until they decide its all too broken so were just gonna nerf it all into the ground. Aside from the self sabotage from the Devs the player base overall on both sides is pretty toxic. Everyone has the right to enjoy the game their own way but when you tunnel people down game after game after game it gets old really quick... Same thing can be said about being anew killer and getting bullied by the survivors. Down someone 4 gens are done the entire team blocks or Flashlight saves. "OH but there's a perk for that" Who wants to take 25% of their power and put it towards a perk because people in the game are toxic? Maybe if they were to do something to address the toxicity in their game and actually listen to player reports their game could be something people could actually enjoy playing. Instead if you decide you dont wanna play with people who are toxic and Disconnect from the game they hit you with a fatass ban. Parents save your money, people save your time. Go play VHS instead of this garbage fire of a game.
The game is awesome it just that some people are toxic and camp so just watch out for that
fajna gierka bo mozna swiecic latarka w morde killera, polecam do pogrania ze znajomymi, chociaz samemu tez jest super

If you view this game as anything you would like to take seriously, you will have a bad time. Tunneling killers, toxic survivors, and a game that has a lot of unfair mechanics on both sides means you should view this game as a horror mario party. Trust me, you'll enjoy yourself much more when you view it in that way. 

This is a great game to play with friends primarily.
one of the best horror multi game to be here ... notihng else needs to be said
Very fun game, especially got horror fans like myself.

I was happy until I played Dead by Daylight.

"Not a perfect game" but still fun and could be your next game to "main"

Let's be honest, there arent many games you are gonna spend over 200hours in them, this is one you easly can.

While the game is not perfect, and looks "simple", its not, there is a good learning curve that only get done the more you play, you are likely gonna be bad on your first 200hours, this is kinda of a "chill esports" game, not competitive but you will try hard to win matches, however there is no reason not to have fun with it.

Game is pretty cheap, even with no disscount, but goes at 50%sale pretty often, also the DLC, dont worry if you like it will spend 10x ingame cosmetics than what you actually paid for the game, just dont go too crazy.

Fun game overall, dont take it too serious because your teammates are gonna be bad most of the time, while survivors can get really toxic if you play killer.

Overall a solid game worth to try with friends

Los killers estan muy rotos. En especial la que vomita, que te puede perseguir por todo el mapa durante horas y tirarte el vomito sin parar de 6 metros y te puede matar sin acercarte a vos. El de la moto cierra se te pone al lado y no sobrevivis ni en pedo. No podes esquivar el hit porque es casi seguro que te la pegue de lleno. Freedy te pega desde 2 metros y te mete en el sue√±o permanentemente. Sal√≠s del sue√±o y a los 25 segundos ya estas metido en el sue√±o de nuevo. La enfermera traspasa todas las paredes y te puede ver. El espectro? Uff ese si que esta roto, se te hace invisible, te aparece y te rompe el orto. Michael de halloween te rompe la cola en velocidad, no te escapas ni en pedo. La chancha te pega un hit desde 3 metros. Seamos claros, digo esto en base a una persona que recien empieza a jugar y no entiende nada del juego. Los killers estan muy rotos y los sobrevivientes trolean demasiado en el juego, se la pasan rusheando y no hacen motores, ni te rescatan, dedican toda la partida a molestar al killer y a no hacer los motores. La verdad no recomendaria este juego a nadie y menos con killers tan rotos.

Luego de 72hs mas, sigo creyendo que el juego esta hecho un asco. Los killers campean y los surv te hacen gestos con las manos para que te sigan y te llevan para adentro de casas y no los agarras mas. Aprendi de eso y no caigo mas en eso, pero para un killer que recien comienza es una completa pesadilla. Deberian penalizar con horas a los que juegan de esa manera.


15/1/2022 Bueno, me acabo de enterar que sale un parche nuevo. Donde ahora se puede hacer una prueba de habilidad de forcejeo en cuanto te agarra el asesino. Eso es muy bueno para un surv, ya que los asesinos te agarran y si alguien no esta ahi para tosquearlo o tantear un hit la verdad que no la contas en cuanto a el cuelgue. Otra cosa que esta muy de mas son la cantidad de ganchos que tiene el asesino. Hay mapas donde el asesino solo tiene que caminar 2 pasos para colgarte porque tiene demasiados ganchos para colgarte. Tambien descubri que el chino capuchino tiene 45 cuchillos jaja. Encima los puede recargar. Que desastre amigo, para el que lo sabe usar realmente es una locura ese chino. Despues esta el gordo trolo este que tira las botellas, al menos lo van a nerfear pero sigue siendo una locura con deslumbrado. En fin, voy a seguir investigando. Pero actualmente el parche que le van a meter es una peque√±es con lo que realmente necesitan abarcar en el juego.

Only problems id have with the game is that the skill gap often plays a key factor in the outcome of your games as people with more experience will obviously have the upper hand and so far the MMR system doesn't seem to be the best for balancing or que times. Also it would probably be a big improvement to the flow of the game if survivors were given other objects other than holding the mouse for 80 seconds, possibly something similar to Friday the 13th where you would have to gather parts to repair gens which would be more interactive for both sides.
(This coming from someone with 700 hours on switch only to return to more suffering)
una basura de juego los mismos bugs desde que salio. todo mal. comprense cosas buenas en vez de este juego de mierda, igual esta bueno comprenlo
The true Horror are the survivors you meet along the way.

I honestly think this game gets kind of a bad wrap. 

Normal play involves either playing as a killer, or teaming up with 3 others to escape the killer. If you're with 4 friends, or even 3 and play online with a stranger as a killer, the game is an absolute blast nearly all of the time. Its intense, scary, bloody, and just really fucking awesome!

Online play is where things can get a little bit less reliably fun. Being a survivor online on your own will usually be fine, but the trouble comes from playing as a killer in online games. Its very common that the 4 survivors will be extremely experienced and sweaty, and end up basically bullying the killer the whole time. However, personally, I don't really mind it! Playing against really skilled survivors makes killing and hunting them down all the more fun and intense and satisfying! Playing this game long-term can sometimes be a chore, especially cuz its been somewhat abandoned by the devs, and isn't updated or balanced nearly enough. But hopping on at any time you can be reasonably sure to have a good time.
